text:
Insights-driven marketing
is changing rapidly.

Chief marketing officers
(CMOs) are facing more challenges,

such as explosive growth in data
from customers as a result

of the pandemic and a deprecation
of third-party cookies and mobile
ad IDs.

Only 14 percent of marketers
say they have a 360-degree
view of their customer.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) can
help CMOs gain real-time

insight of customers and the
market.

AWS lets you define and manage
your security, governance,

and auditing policies to satisfy
industry and geography-specific
regulations.

With AWS, you can access your
data wherever it lives, and we

can help you keep your data
secure no matter where you store
it.

Speaking of lots of data, market
leaders are investing in personalization
to meet customer expectations.

In fact, consumers now expect
personalized experiences
from businesses.

Market research tells us that 63 percent
of consumers see personalization
as the standard level of service.

Generic recommendations
no longer meet customer

expectations and can sometimes
turn consumers off.

Cloud technology is a powerful
way to get immediate insight

and personalization
for your customers.

I’d like to share how Domino’s
Pizza partnered with AWS to create

a personalized customer
experience each time a pizza
is ordered.

Domino’s typically has up to five
promotions: national, regional,

store, new-product,
and event tie-ins, such as movies
and sports.

Not to mention, Domino’s
offers millions of combinations
of pizzas and toppings.

So, how do they present the right
offers to the right customers?

With AWS, Domino’s implemented
a marketing tool that includes

personalized transaction
data and a product catalog.

It uses machine learning
(ML) to match customers

with the right products
and promotions in real time.

By adopting ML, marketers
and businesses can adapt to changes

in customer intent instantaneously
rather than in retrospect.

It even solved for cold-start
scenarios with new customers
and menu items.
